author: jjasghar
body:
I was attempting to use the alias for `sort` and it seems that it calls to `/usr/bin/sort` instead of the Powershell alias to `Sort-Object`. 

I am using PowerShell on MacOS.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```
PS /Users/jjasghar/scripts> Get-VM | select VMHost,Name | sort VMHost,Name
/usr/bin/sort: open failed: VMHost,Name: No such file or directory
PS /Users/jjasghar/scripts> Get-VM | select VMHost,Name | Sort-Object VMHost,Name

VMHost      Name
------      ----
172.16.20.3 automate-ubuntu
172.16.20.3 chef-automate
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
```
PS /Users/jjasghar/scripts> Get-VM | select VMHost,Name | sort VMHost,Name

VMHost      Name
------      ----
172.16.20.3 automate-ubuntu
172.16.20.3 chef-automate
```

Actual behavior
---------------
```
PS /Users/jjasghar/scripts> Get-VM | select VMHost,Name | sort VMHost,Name
/usr/bin/sort: open failed: VMHost,Name: No such file or directory
PS /Users/jjasghar/scripts> Get-VM | select VMHost,Name | Sort-Object VMHost,Name

VMHost      Name
------      ----
172.16.20.3 automate-ubuntu
172.16.20.3 chef-automate
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.18
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```
title: sort alias is defaulting to /usr/bin/sort on MacOS
